summary: Feature request to evaluate explicit Rails integration/gem for the Ruby SDK, including Rails config/DI, code generation, ActiveJob integration, and ActiveModel/ActiveRecord support. After research and sample development, the team concluded there isn't enough substantial Rails-specific integration needed to justify an explicit gem beyond documentation and samples.
userImpact: Ruby developers using Rails can follow the sample implementation and documentation for Temporal integration without requiring an explicit SDK gem.
proposedFix: Provide sample Rails application and documentation on using Temporal with Rails, focusing on ActiveModel/ActiveRecord conversion support.
workaround: Use plain Ruby SDK without Rails-specific integration; manual client initialization and setup.
resolutionDetails: Team determined that insufficient Rails-specific integration points exist to justify an explicit gem. A sample implementation at https://github.com/temporalio/samples-ruby/tree/main/rails_app was created to demonstrate integration without requiring SDK-level support.
keyQuote: Rails integration has been demonstrated in a sample at https://github.com/temporalio/samples-ruby/tree/main/rails_app, but there is nothing substantial enough over plain Ruby use to justify an explicit integration
